forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 62. Southwest wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers before 5pm. Partly sunny, with a high near 68. Southwest wind 5 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%.

weather_report:
As the night deepens over Downtown San Francisco, the air is heavy with a lingering promise of rain, though the clouds have maintained their distance, allowing glimpses of the star-speckled sky. With temperatures hovering around a gentle 62 degrees, a light southwest wind nudges the occasional leaf from its perch, whispering of the change to come. The forecast hints at a chance of rain showers that may grace the city before day’s end, draping a curtain of moisture over the lively streets.

Come morning, the Bay will awaken with the effervescent play of sun and cloud, punctuated by a moderate breeze that dances through the alleyways. The thermometer may reach a comfortable 68, but the marine layer could hang on like a friend reluctant to part. Dress in layers to embrace the shifting moods of the day—perhaps a light jacket accompanied by a scarf for those early hours when the chill stirs in from the ocean. This is a day for wandering the neighborhood cafés, savoring the aroma of freshly brewed coffee, or perhaps taking a stroll along the waterfront, where the city hums softly with the rhythm of its own pulse. A leisurely visit to a local gallery or an afternoon spent beneath the shade of a tree in one of the parks can make for a beautifully unhurried experience, welcoming the hint of rain as an artist welcomes inspiration.
